a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: State-based conflicts are between states, or a state and a non-state armed group. One-sided violence – such as
massacres or genocide – is not included.
Data source: OWID based on UCDP/PRIO
Note: Conflicts are included if fighting in them caused at least 25 military and civilian deaths in a year.
